summary:
"Nevermind" is Nirvana's second album, released in 1991. It's their first with drummer Dave Grohl and was produced by Butch Vig. The album has a wider range of emotions and sounds than their previous work, influenced by bands like Pixies and Melvins. It includes songs like "Smells Like Teen Spirit" and "Come as You Are."

"Nevermind" became a huge success, reaching number one on the US Billboard 200 and selling millions worldwide. It made Nirvana superstars and brought grunge music to the mainstream. The album is considered one of the greatest and most influential rock albums of all time.
title: Nevermind
